“ In the protection of his or her constitutional and legal rights , freedoms and interests , or in defending a criminal charge , everyone has the right to a fair and public hearing , within a reasonable time , by an independent and impartial court established by law . ”

Article CARDINAL : Identification of persons

“ CARDINAL . When the need arises to conduct the identification of a person , the proceeding authority invites the person who must conduct the identification to describe the person ( to be identified ) , relating all the features he or she remembers and that person is asked whether he / she has been previously summoned to do the identification and about other circumstances , which may contribute to the accuracy of the identification .
CARDINAL . Actions provided for by paragraph CARDINAL and statements made by the person who does the identification are entered in the records .
CARDINAL . Non - compliance with the provisions of DATE and CARDINAL is a cause for the invalidity of the identification . ”
Article CARDINAL : Performing identification

CARDINAL . The proceeding authority , after taking away the person who will do the identification , ensures the presence of CARDINAL persons , looking as alike as possible , to the person to be identified . It invites the latter to choose his or her place in relation to others , taking care to be portrayed , as much as possible , in the same circumstances under which he or she would have been seen by the person called to do the identification . After the person who will do the identification has appeared , the court asks the latter whether he or she knows any of those presented for identification , and if yes , to point out the person he or she knows and to specify whether he or she is sure .

CARDINAL . When there are reasons to believe that the person called to do the identification may be afraid or influenced by the presence of the person to be identified , the proceeding authority orders the act to be performed without the latter seeing the former .

CARDINAL . The records must describe how the identification was performed , failure to do so invalidates the identification . The proceeding authority may order , for records purposes , the performance of the identification to be photographed or filmed .
Article CARDINAL : Identification of items

CARDINAL . When the identification of material evidence or other items relevant to the criminal offence must be performed , the proceeding authority acts in compliance with the rules for identification of persons to the extent that they are applicable .

CARDINAL . After finding , when possible , CARDINAL similar items to the one to be identified , the proceeding authority asks the person called to identify whether he / she recognises any of them and , if the answer is yes , invites him / her to state which of them he / she recognised and to specify whether he / she is sure .
CARDINAL . The records must describe how the identification was performed , failure to do so invalidates the identification .
Article CARDINAL : Identification of or by several persons

CARDINAL . When several persons are called to do the identification of the same person or item , the proceeding authority performs it CARDINAL by CARDINAL separately , prohibiting any communication between the one who has done the identification and those who will do it subsequently .
CARDINAL . When a person must identify several persons or items , the proceeding authority orders the person or item to be identified to be placed among different persons or items .
